title: Glitchy Graphics
body:
Ever since I started playing league, Ive always had a problem with my graphics, certain pixels will stretch across the whole map and flash constantly (sometimes even on my own champion, causing the glitch to follow me the whole game). Lately it has gotten unbearable but I dont exactly know if its a problem worth replacing my graphics card. Would really like some help fixing this.
My laptop consists of:
CPU: Intel core i5-3210M
GPU: NVIDIA GeForce 610M
(This is my first post so I dont know how to add an image, but Im sure If I knew it would make the job a lot easier for you)

replies.body:
Reinstall your graphics driver. Make sure that you're not using integrated graphics.

There's every possibility your Graphics Card has simply had it. No point replacing it though - get a whole new laptop. It's a 5 year-old graphics card. It's not *meant* to last this long.
Fixing my issues might not be that exciting for you and you probably do it a lot, but thank you so much for that comment. Re-installing my graphics driver fixed my Graphics glitches.

Quick Note:  I have seen on some other thread that this is happening to multiple different games, like Team Fortress 2 and CS:GO. But this is only happening on LoL and I've never had a problem like it.
